title: Matchsafe, ""Full of the D"", copyrighted 1888
markings: Lion passant, anchor, gothic letter "G", COPYRIGHT 1888, all stamped on front bezel. Lion's head, STERLING, 695, all stamped on reverse bezel.
provenance: Collection of Carol B. Brener and Stephen W. Brener
creditline: Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener
description: Rectangular, rounded corners and sides, featuring raised relief of devil poking his head and hand through a jagged or torn edged reserve, inscribed "Full of the D" on upper left of lid, just above his head. Reverse features raised relief of hand bursting through small torn edged reserve, clutching three burning matches, also visible is devil's tail bursting through  area to the upper-left of hand, interwined around the matches. Lid hinged on side. Striker in recessed groove on bottom.

tombstone.epitaph:
Matchsafe, ""Full of the D"", copyrighted 1888.
copyrighted 1888. Silver. Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener. 1978-146-693.
